snippet.title: TempleOS: an educational tool for programming experiments
snippet.description: James Sanders explores what drives one man to write an operating system for x86_64, and what the programmer's finished product looks like.

snippet.title: FPS (First Person Shooter) games
snippet.description: What is the premise of these games? You walk around dressed like a combat soldier with an automatic weapon and kill anyone and everyone...sound familiar? The Sept 11 hijackers us...

snippet.title: 10 IT relics I really miss
snippet.description: Do you remember the days of BBSes and shareware subscriptions, magazines full of BASIC code for your CoCo, and true desktop cases? Take a techie stroll down memory lane.

snippet.title: How to identify and target a profitable IT consulting niche
snippet.description: Charge more than burger-flipping rates for your IT consulting work by specializing. Read tips on how finding and evaluating a niche market.

snippet.title: Human-Mobility-Based Sensor Context-Aware Routing Protocol for Delay-Tolerant Data Gathering in Multi-Sink Cell-Phone-Based Sensor Networks
snippet.description: Ubiquitous use of cell phones encourages development of novel applications with sensors embedded in cell phones. The collection of information generated by these devices is a chall...

snippet.title: Why Microsoft's Kinect and Google's Android are headed to space
snippet.description: A UK space project wants to replace traditional spacecraft computer hardware with smartphones and video games controllers.

snippet.title: Ultra-Wide Bandwidth Timing Networks
snippet.description: The authors present an algorithm for ultra-precise timing in large wireless networks. Their approach uses physical-layer UWB round-trip time-of-flight measurements to achieve preci...

snippet.title: Heterogeneous Highly Parallel Implementation of Matrix Exponentiation Using GPU
snippet.description: The vision of super computer at every desk can be realized by powerful and highly parallel CPUs or GPUs or APUs. Graphics processors once specialized for the graphics applications ...

snippet.title: AtG: did someone say launches?
snippet.description: While Australia slept, the wraps came off a quartet of technologies; plus, we see when the NBN is heading your way.

snippet.title: Microsoft shouldn't try to be a hardware company
snippet.description: Deb Shinder would prefer to see Microsoft focus on making better software and letting companies with more experience worry about the hardware.
